intro: Chaetanthera chilensis var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
